page.title: 14ERSKINE HOSPITAL
page.content: The Princess Louise Scottish Hospital in Erskine was founded in 1916. Its function is to treat, care and rehabilitate disabled ex-servicemen. Many of the patients require permanent care. The hospital has 270 beds and 53 houses in the grounds occupied by disabled men who are able to live with thier families. There is also a workshop which provides employment for 50 men and there is a hostel to accomodate men not in need of full hospital care. The hospital is very well equipped.It has its own resident medical and nursing staff. It also has its own operating theatre. In the grounds there is a market garden where they sell flowers and vegetables. The hospital workshop produces art and crafts for sale in the hospital shop. Patient's ages range from 23 to 98 years.
